column4: I'm trying to navigate my file system through the terminal, but everytime I come across a filename with a space in it I can't navigate the terminal because it sees the spaces as the end of the command string.
What am I doing wrong? I know it must be an obvious answers..
put a \ in front of the space
1 sec, I'll try
no go
you know that you can also start typing a few letters of the file or directory name, and hit tab, and it should complete it automaticallty
you used a backslash like this \, not a forward slash like this /, right?
http://pastebin.com/m1b74bbab
I just said, be sure you're using a BACKSLASH like this: \ not a forward slash like this: / :)
and therein lies the problem, thanks. I knew it was a stupid mistake
well, look at the line in your menu.lst that you're trying to load, and check what disk it is claiming it is on
how wold I go about doing that? I be a noob.
it worked two seconds before I restated it, all should be fine..
and what did you do before you restarted?
well I actually hibernated it, and then accidentally powered it on and off numerous times..
so you can't boot it now at all, eh...
no.. sucks. Can you help?
there's not much I can do. You can try looking into this: http://supergrub.forjamari.linex.org/
you could also try booting off the install CD to try to fix your disks, but I have no idea what you've done to them... sounds like your drive is hurt
ah man SGD didn't work, any other ideas?
not really - it sounds like you could have damaged the drive/partition
impossible, that would suck.
impossible? yes it would suck, but you said you kept kicking it on and off over and over
